title.native: デジモンクロスウォーズ 時を駆ける少年ハンターたち
title.romaji: Digimon Xros Wars: Toki wo Kakeru Shounen Hunter-tachi
title.english: Digimon Xros Wars: The Young Hunters Who Leapt Through Time

description: Continuation of the Digimon Xros Wars series featuring Taiki Kudou in a new world with new supporting characters. The plot revolves around a secret hidden in the gap between the real and digital worlds, with Tagiru Akashi holding the key to the story.
synonyms: Digimon Xros Wars: Toki wo Kakeru Shounen Huntertachi
Digimon Xros Wars: The Hunting Boys Running Through Time

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Crossover
tags.description: Centers around the placement of two or more otherwise discrete fictional characters, settings, or universes into the context of a single story.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

title.native: デジモンクロスウォーズ～悪のデスジェネラルと七つの王国～
デジモンアドベンチャー
デジモンアドベンチャー０２
デジモンフロンティア

alternative: Digimon Kaiser (デジモンカイザー)

node.description:
He's credited on all relevant media as the creator of the original concept and character designs for the virtual pet franchise, Digimon. However, nothing is known about Hongo as an individual.

The name is actually a pseudonym for the three most important figures in the creation of the Digimon franchise: Aki Maita, one of the two creators of the original Tamagotchi; Hiroshi Izawa, the author of the first Digimon manga; and Takeichi Hongo, the director of marketing for Bandai.

(Source: Digimon Wikia)

[Website](http://wadakoji.com/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/和田光司)

Kouji Wada was best known for performing several songs for the [Digimon](https://anilist.co/anime/552/) series.

On April 3, 2016, he suddenly passed away due to complications related to nasopharynx cancer.

[Website](http://psychiclover.net)

Psychic Lover (サイキックラバー) is a J-pop band consisting of vocalist YOFFY (Yoshiyuki Wada / 和田よしゆき) and guitarist [IMAJO](https://anilist.co/staff/357213) (Tatsuhiro Imajo / 今城龍寛). Originally consisting of six members, YOFFY and IMAJO are the only two who remained for their rise to fame. Much of their work has been featured as opening and closing themes of Japanese television series and anime. YOFFY has also worked with Eizo Sakamoto (vocalist of [Anthem](https://anilist.co/staff/191547/) and Animetal), [Masaaki Endou](https://anilist.co/staff/101528/), [Sakura Nogawa](https://anilist.co/staff/95204/), [Ai Tokunaga](https://anilist.co/staff/95324), [Ryouko Shintani](https://anilist.co/staff/95315/), [Mayumi Gojou](https://anilist.co/staff/107007/), [Sister MAYO](https://anilist.co/staff/345387/), and [Yukari Fukui](https://anilist.co/staff/95359/) on other projects.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kz_lt)__

kz (pronounced "k-zet") (also known as RE:NDZ) is one of the early authors of Hatsune Miku songs, and most of his works have become hits, starting with his debut, "Packaged." He is skilled at creating reverberant, technopop pieces with Hatsune Miku. Though he has not been active on Nico Nico Douga since late 2008, he did create the new songs "Far Away" and "Star Story" for the release of the July 2009 Sony PSP game "Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA", and it's July 29, 2010 sequel "Hatsune Miku: Project DIVA 2nd".  kz is the sole member of the amateur music circle livetune who, in late 2007, released an a Vocaloid album titled "Re:package" at Comic Market 73. It was then resold by Victor Entertainment with a major circulation release on August 28, 2008, making it the first Hatsune Miku CD to be sold by a major label.   livetune was originally a 2 member unit, made up by kz and kajyuki. However, kajyuki left in 2008 to work at CAPCOM, leaving kz as the only member.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oja0222digi)

Affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) since 1987.

[Seki-sensei](https://anilist.co/character/14098/) in [Ojamajo Doremi](https://anilist.co/anime/350/) is named after her.
